MenuItemBuilder is a MenuMaker helper class that represents an individual option on the menu
Can be a regular option or specifically a toggle
Options are menu items presented in a #. Name - Description format and are generally used to access features within a module's settings or to access modules themselves
Toggles are a type of menu option that include specific handling for options which can be enabled or disabled. This is provided to simplify creation of Options for managing Booleans

settingsHandler manages the disk-writable representation of winapp2ool module properties for persistence between sessions by deserializing the winapp2ool.ini file into their respective module settings, monitoring any changes during the session and serializing them back to disk as needed.
A real-time copy of all disk-writable settings is stored in a Dictionary (Of String, Dictionary (Of String, String)) where the primary key is the module name and the secondary key is the setting name
The settings are also stored in an iniFile , updated alongside the dictionary, for on-disk formatting purposes and can be read from or written to disk as needed
Docs last updated: 2025-06-25 | Code last updated 2025-06-25

A copy of winapp2ool's current set of user configurable settings that can be read from or written to disk in a familiar ini format
If saveSettingsToDisk is True , then this file will be overwritten on disk every time a setting is updated
Docs last updated: 2025-06-25 | Code last updated: 2025-06-25

A cleaner structure for accessing module settings which can be easily written to settingsFile
Keys in the primary dictionary are module names, the value dictionaries are simple key value pairs where the key is the name of a setting and the value is the value of the setting
Docs last updated: 2025-06-25 | Code last updated: 2025-06-25

If saving is enabled, saves the current state of winapp2ool's settings to disk, overwriting any existing settings

Holds the settings for the Browser Builder module, which allows winapp2ool to build bespoke entries for indivudal web browsers through a simple scripting interface
Summary of Browser Builder files and their expected content:
BuilderFile1
chromium.ini - the generative rulesets for Chromium-based browsers - either this or BuilderFile2 must be present in order for Browser Builder to run
BuilderFile2
gecko.ini - the generative rulesets for Gecko/Goanna-based browsers - either this or BuilderFile1 must be present in order for Browser Builder to run
BuilderFile3
browsers.ini - Browser Builder saves its output here
BuilderFile4
browser_additions.ini - The set of entries and keys to be added to browsers.ini after generation
BuilderFile5
browser_section_removals.ini - The optional set of sections to be entirely removed from browsers.ini after generation
BuilderFile6
browser_name_removals.ini - The optional set of individual keys to be removed by Name from browsers.ini after generation
BuilderFile7
browser_key_replacements.ini - The optional set of individual keys to have their values replace the ones browsers.ini after generation
BuilderFile8
browser_section_replacements.ini - The optional set of sections to entirely replace sections of the same in browsers.ini after generation
BuilderFile9
browser_value_removals.ini - The optional set of individual keys to be removed by value from browsers.ini after generation
Remarks:
Only the generative rulesets need to be segregated by browser engine. All other files contain a mix of chromium, gecko, and/or any other extant browser engines or embedded runtimes
Docs last updated: 2025-07-30 | Code last updated: 2025-07-30

The iniFile containing the generative information for Chromium browser entries
This should include a set of BrowserInfo sections defining the individual web browsers and a set of EntryScaffold sections defining the structure of the individual entries

CCiniDebug is a winapp2ool module which performs housekeeping on the CCleaner configuration file ccleaner.ini to clean up leftovers from winapp2.ini
As entries are removed or renamed in winapp2.ini over time, stale configuration keys are leftover in ccleaner.ini. CCiniDebug processes a ccleaner.ini for its entry configuration keys and checks them each against the names of entries in winapp2.ini. Any configuration keys found with the winapp2.ini indicator (*) in the name which do not have a corresponding entry by the same name in the most recent winapp2.ini can then be easily and automatically removed
Docs last updated: 2025-08-05 | Code last updated: 2025-08-05

Handles the commandline args for CCiniDebug
CCiniDebug setting toggles: -noprune : disable pruning of stale winapp2.ini entries -nosort : disable sorting ccleaner.ini alphabetically -nosave : disable saving the modified ccleaner.ini back to file

Combine is a winapp2ool module that takes all files with the ini extension within a target directory (including its subdirectories) and combines them into a single ini file. When duplicate section names are encountered, their unique keys are merged together into the output.
Files that cannot be parsed or have no sections are ignored.
If the final combined output contains no sections, it will not be saved to disk
Docs last updated: 2025-08-23

Compares two winapp2.ini format iniFile s and summarizes the changes to the user
NOTE: to "exist" here means for an entry of the same exact name (case sensitive) to exist
Changes fall three major categories:
Added entries exist in the new file and not in the old file
Modified entries exist in both the new file and the old file and have been changed in some way
Removed entries exist in the old file but not in the new file
Additionally, Removed entries have three sub categories:
Renamed entries do not exist in the new file, but their content exists in some other entry in the file, mostly unchanged from the old version (may contain minor changes)
Merged entries do not exist in the new file, but their content exists in some other entry in the new file which is substantially different from the old version
Removed without replacement do not exist in the new file and their content was not found in some other entry in the new file
Likewise, Merged entries themselves are broken into two categories
Modified Entries that existed in the old file which have been modified to contain content from entries which have been removed
Added Entries which did not exist in the old file but who contain content from entries which have been removed

Maintains the global log for winapp2ool, which is used to track internal operations and errors. Provides methods for adding to the log, saving it to disk, and printing it to the console.
Docs last updated: 2025-06-19 | Code last updated: 2025-06-19

The global Winapp2ool log, containing everything logged during the current session

Holds the settings for the Flavorizer module, which provides a user interface for applying "flavors" (sets of modifications) to ini files.
The flavorization process uses multiple correction files applied in this order: 1. Section Removal (File3) -> Remove entire sections 2. Key Name Removal (File4) -> Remove keys by name matching 3. Key Value Removal (File5) -> Remove keys by value and keytype matching 4. Section Replacement (File6) -> Replace entire sections 5. Key Replacement (File7) -> Replace individual key values 6. Section and Key Additions (File8) -> Add new sections and keys
All correction files are optional - the flavorization will skip any that are not specified or do not exist.
Docs last updated: 2025-08-01 | Code last updated: 2025-08-01

The base iniFile to which the flavor will be applied
Docs last updated: 2025-08-01 | Code last updated: 2025-08-01

The location to which the Flavorizer will save its output
Docs last updated: 2025-08-01 | Code last updated: 2025-08-01

Section removal file - contains sections to be removed entirely from the base file.
Sections will be removed regardless of their content.
Applied in the first stage of flavorization.
Docs last updated: 2025-08-01 | Code last updated: 2025-08-01

Key name removal file - contains keys to be removed by name matching.
Keys must be within sections that match exactly (case sensitive).
The values in this file are ignored - only key names matter.
Applied in the second stage of flavorization.
Docs last updated: 2025-08-01 | Code last updated: 2025-08-01

Key value removal file - contains keys to be removed by keytype and value matching.
Numbers in key names are ignored for matching purposes.
Both the keytype (name without numbers) and value must match.
Applied in the third stage of flavorization.
Docs last updated: 2025-08-01 | Code last updated: 2025-08-01

Section replacement file - contains complete sections that will replace
sections of the same name in the base file.
Section names must match exactly (case sensitive).
This completely replaces the section content.
Applied in the fourth stage of flavorization.
Docs last updated: 2025-08-01 | Code last updated: 2025-08-01

Key replacement file - contains individual keys that will replace
keys of the same name within matching sections in the base file.
Both section names and key names must match exactly (case sensitive).
Applied in the fifth stage of flavorization.
Docs last updated: 2025-08-01 | Code last updated: 2025-08-01

Additions file - contains sections and keys to be added to the base file.
New sections will be added as-is.
Keys within existing sections will be added to those sections.
Applied in the sixth and final stage of flavorization.
Docs last updated: 2025-08-01 | Code last updated: 2025-08-01

The Flavorizer module provides a user interface for applying "flavors" to ini files. A flavor is a set of modifications that adapt a base ini file for specific use cases.
The flavorization process applies modifications in this specific order: 1. Section Removal -> Remove entire sections 2. Key Name Removal -> Remove keys by name matching 3. Key Value Removal -> Remove keys by value and keytype matching 4. Section Replacement -> Replace entire sections 5. Key Replacement -> Replace individual key values 6. Section and Key Additions -> Add new sections and keys
If a modification file isn't present, that modification will be skipped
This module wraps Transmute's Flavorize function with an intuitive UI for managing the multiple correction files used in the flavorization process and also provides the ability to detect a group of flavor files within a particular directory for ease of configuration
Docs last updated: 2025-08-05 | Code last updated: 2025-08-05

Handles command line arguments for the Flavorizer module
Flavorizer args: -nowinapp : Disable processing as winapp2.ini format (default: true) -autodetect : Automatically detect a group of Flavor files in the target directory
To refer -autodetect to a different directory than the current one, also provide -9d with the appropriate directory. FlavorizerFile9 holds the target directory for the auto detect function within its Dir property

members.member:
Transmute (formerly Merge ) is a winapp2ool module which provides the ability to modify an iniFile object using the contents of a separate iniFile object with conflict resolution at different levels of granularity.
In the parlance of Transmute, there are two files of interest:
The 'base' file and the 'source' file
The 'base' file is the one whose content will be modified by the operation. That is, this file will be either added to, removed from, or have some or all of its content modified
Likewise, the 'source' file is the one from which the modifications will be provided. That is, this file will have its content added to, removed from, or replace content in the 'base' file
Transmute modes:
Add (Default transmute mode)
Adds sections to the base file from the source file
If a section from the source file exists in the base file, the individual keys will be added
Replace
Replace has two sub modes: BySection and ByKey
ByKey (Default replace mode): Replaces the value of keys in the base file with values from the source file based on their Name
BySection: Replaces entire sections in the base file with the section of the same name in the source file.
Note: Replace does nothing with sections from the source file not found in the base file
Remove
Remove has two sub modes: BySection and ByKey
ByKey (Default remove mode): Removes keys from individual sections within the base file
Keys must be provided within a section in the source file and will be removed from the corresponding section of the same name in the base file
Remove Key Modes:
ByName : Removes keys based on matching key names only
Removing a key with this mode requires knowledge of its Name. This works best for unnumbered keys (in the context of winapp2.ini, keys like Section, or unnumbered Detection keys) but also works for numbered keys if you know the number. For numbered keys it is generally best to try using the ByValue remove mode
ByValue : Removes keys based on matching key values. The KeyType (key name without numbers) must also match. Works best for numbered keys whose numbers may change or be unclear when invoking Transmute
Additionally, Transmute provides an important function called Flavorize. Flavorize is used to apply "flavors" to an ini file. In the context on winapp2.ini, there has historically existed at least one flavor: the "non-ccleaner" file. Flavorize automates and also democratizes what has historically been a very labor intensive process: Maintaining a concise set of transformations on the base winapp2.ini that can be used to adapt it to different purposes. The flavorization process always takes in a base ini file and then applies operations in the following order:
Section Removal -> Key Name Removal -> Key Value Removal -> Section Replacement -> Key Replacement -> Section and Key Additions
Remarks:
Transmute replaces the Merge module and has has three modes which are wholly discrete from one another. This is a breaking change from old versions of Merge prior to 2025, which always add entries which don't exist and perform conflict resolution as part of that process.
As the functionality of Merge evolved, it no longer felt appropriate to refer to its output as the result of a "merger" necessarily. We now consider the resulting output a Transmutation. Nevertheless, this is still spiritually the Merge module
Docs last updated: 2025-07-25 | Code last updated: 2025-07-25

Enum representing the different primary modes of modifying the base file

member.name: F:winapp2ool.Transmute.TransmuteMode.Add
member.summary:
Add the content of the source file into the base file
For sections in the source file not found in the base file, they will be added as is
sections already existing in the base file will have the keys from the source file added

member.name: F:winapp2ool.Transmute.TransmuteMode.Replace
member.summary:
Overwrite the content of individual sections or keys in the base file with content from the source file.
Whether replacements are done by section or by key is is controlled by a separate enum ReplaceMode

member.name: F:winapp2ool.Transmute.TransmuteMode.Remove
member.summary:
Remove from the base file any keys or sections found in the source file.
Whether replacements are done by section or by key is controlled by a separate enum called RemoveMode
Whether key removals are done by Name or by Value is controlled by a separate enum called RemoveKeyMode

members.member:
Enum representing the granularity of replace operations
Docs last updated: 2025-07-25 | Code last updated: 2025-07-25

member.name: F:winapp2ool.Transmute.ReplaceMode.BySection
member.summary:
Replaces entire sections when collisions occur
This means that if a section exists in the base file, it will be replaced entirely with the section from the source file. Section names must match exactly (case sensitive)

member.name: F:winapp2ool.Transmute.ReplaceMode.ByKey
member.summary:
Replace individual keys when collisions occur
This means that if a key exists in the base file, its value will be replaced with the value from the source file. The key must exist in both files and have the same Name

member.name: T:winapp2ool.Transmute.RemoveMode
member.summary: Enum representing the granularity of remove operations

member.name: F:winapp2ool.Transmute.RemoveMode.BySection
F:winapp2ool.Transmute.RemoveMode.ByKey
member.summary:
Remove individual keys when collisions occur
This means that if a key exists in the base file, it will be removed if it also exists in the source file. The key must exist in both files and have the same KeyType (key name without numbers). Section names must match exactly (case sensitive)

member.name: T:winapp2ool.Transmute.RemoveKeyMode
member.summary: Enum representing the criteria for removing keys

member.name: F:winapp2ool.Transmute.RemoveKeyMode.ByName
member.summary: Remove keys if they have the same Name (value to the left of the equals sign)

member.name: F:winapp2ool.Transmute.RemoveKeyMode.ByValue
member.summary: Remove keys if they have the same KeyType (Name with numbers removed) and Value

member.name: P:winapp2ool.Transmute.Transmutator
member.summary:
The primary transmutation mode for the Transmute module
Default: Add
Add
Adds sections from the source file to the base file. If a section exists already in the base file, the keys from the source section will be added to the base section. Section names must match exactly (case sensitive)
Replace
Contains two sub modes. Replaces sections or individual keys in the base file with content from the source file. Section names must match exactly (case sensitive)
Remove
Contains two sub modes one of which itself contains two sub modes. Removes sections or individual keys from the base file. Key removal can be performed by value (ignores key numbering but requires a key type) or by key name (works best for unnumbered keys)

members.member:
The granularity level for the Replace Transmutator , has two sub modes
Default: ByKey
BySection
Replaces entire sections when collisions occur
ByKey
Replaces individual keys when collisions occur
Docs last updated: 2025-07-30 | Code last updated: 2025-07-30

The granularity level for the Remove Transmutator , has two sub modes
Default: ByKey
BySection
Removes entire sections when collisions occur
ByKey
Removes individual keys when collisions occur
Docs last updated: 2025-07-30 | Code last updated: 2025-07-30

The granularity level for the Remove by Key Transmutator , has two sub modes
Default: ByName
ByName
Removes keys from the base section if they have the same name as a key in the source section
Ignores provided values
ByValue
Removes keys from the base section if they have the same KeyType and Value
Ignores numbers in the Name of the iniKey

member.name: M:winapp2ool.Transmute.handleCmdLine
member.summary: Handles the commandline args for Transmute
member.remarks:
Transmute args:
Primary modes:
-add : Add mode (default)
-replace : Replace mode
-remove : Remove mode
Sub-mode: shared by remove/replace since only one can be done at a time
-bysection : Replace/Remove by section
-bykey : Replace/Remove by key (default)
Remove key criteria:
-byname : Remove keys by name (default)
-byvalue : Remove keys by value
Winapp2.ini syntax correction
-dontlint : do not save output with winapp2.ini formatting
Preset base file choices
-r : removed entries.ini
-c : custom.ini
-w : winapp3.ini
-a : archived entries.ini
-b : browsers.ini

Conducts the transmutation on the base file using the source file and saves the output to the location provided within saveFile.
Typically by default, the output is saved to the base file, overwriting the original content.
If working on a winapp2.ini file, the output can be formatted accordingly
member.param: The iniFile whose content will be modified by the transmutation process
The iniFile providing the transmutation data
Contains the path to which the transmuted output will be written
A MenuSection containing the Transmute output to be displayed to the user
Indicates that the saveFile should be formatted as a winapp2.ini file

Applies a 'flavor' to an iniFile . A flavor is like a compatibility layer that allows a base file to be adjusted in slight ways to make it more suitable to a specific use
In the context of winapp2.ini, we can use this to create different versions of winapp2.ini for different use cases (eg. a CCleaner or BleachBit specific versions) or else to correct the output of generative components of winapp2ool
Always applies Flavorings in the following order:
Section Removal -> Key Name Removal -> Key Value Removal -> Section Replacement -> Key Replacement -> Section and Key Additions
The iniFile to whom a particular flavor will be applied
The location on disk to which the flavorized baseFile will be saved
The MenuSection containing output to be displayed to the user
The iniFile containing the set of sections and individual keys within sections which should be added to to create the flavor
Optional, Default: Nothing
The iniFile containing the set of sections to be removed from the to create the flavor
Sections will be removed regardless of whether or not keys are provided
Optional, Default: Nothing
The iniFile containing the set of individual keys to be removed from the when matched by their Name parameter to create the flavor
The values provided for keys in this file do not matter and will not be used for matching
Optional, Default: Nothing
The iniFile containing the set of individual keys to be removed from the when matched by their KeyName and Value pairs to create the flavor
Numbers in key names will be ignored in this file and can be omitted. Numberless name and value pairs will be used for matching.
Optional, Default: Nothing
The iniFile containing the set of sections to replace entire sections of an exactly matching (case sensitive) name in the to create the flavor
This will not preserve non-overlapping content from the base key
Optional, Default: Nothing
The iniFile containing the set of individual keys to replace within a matching section within to create the flavor
Keys in this file will only replace keys in the base file if both their Seciton and Key names match exactly (case sensitive)
Optional, Default: Nothing
Indicates that the iniFile being flavorized has winapp2.ini syntax
Optional, Default: True
Docs last updated: 2025-08-27 | Code last updated: 2025-08-27

BrowserBuilder is a winapp2ool module which handles the generation of bespoke winapp2.ini entries for a very large number of web browsers. It provides a small scripting interface which allows for the dynamic creation of entire groups of winapp2.ini entries using a limited set of easily accessed information.
This module expects to interact with at least one of two specially formatted ini files. These files, chromium.ini and gecko.ini, provide the rulesets needed to generate entries for web browsers running with these respective engines. Refer to these files for more specific documentation on how they are used by the user. BrowserBuilder is primarily intended as a small devops tool but end users might find it useful as it enables them to generate entries for non standard installation paths or portable applications while keeping winapp2.ini up to date separately
Additionally, and because it is intended to simplify the devops, Browser Builder expects to "Flavorize" the browsers.ini that it produces. This is done so as to resolve over and under coverages by generated entries as well as resolve incompatibilities. Accordingly, it expects but does not require a set of Flavor files (up to 1 "Add" file, up to 3 "Remove" files, and up to 2 "Replace" files). Consult the Transmute documentation for more information about Flavors
Unflavored browser.ini files may be broken or incomplete depending on use case
Docs last updated: 2025-08-01 | Code last updated: 2025-08-01
